contextId.information: You may need to make explicit that the house was for people to worship Yahweh. AT: "a house in ... Judea where people can worship him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for him a house in ... Judea

contextId.information: This begins to list the number of people whose ancestors had lived in towns in Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

You may need to make explicit what it was about the people of the land that made the Jews afraid. AT: "because they thought the people of the land wanted to attack them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because of the people of the land

contextId.information: This is a festival that was celebrated for eight days during the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. It was associated with the time of the exodus when the Israelites lived in tents. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

You may need to make explicit that there was no house of God standing when they arrived. AT: "to where the house of God had stood" or "to where they were going to build the house of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

What they were to investigate can be stated clearly. AT: "ordered his officials to investigate the records" or "ordered his officials to search and find out if there was a record of King Cyrus telling the Jews to build the house of God in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It can be stated clearly that this is the first year of his reign. AT: "In year 1 of the reign of King Cyrus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: In the first year of King Cyrus

contextId.information: "The king's tribute" refers to taxes that people pay the king. AT: "Money from the taxes that you collect for the king from the people beyond the river" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Funds from the king's tribute beyond the River

contextId.information: These people had been captured and taken to Babylon, but they returned to Jerusalem. AT: "the rest of the people who had been taken captive to Babylon and had returned to Jerusalem " or "the rest of the people who had returned from captivity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Where Ezra came up to can be stated clearly. AT: "Ezra came up to Jerusalem from Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The phrase "in full" means as many as are necessary to complete the task. They were to use the gold and silver to buy all they needed in order to worship God in the the temple. AT: "Buy as many of the oxen, rams, lambs, grain and drink offerings as are needed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "them" refers to the nine leaders and two teachers written about in [[:en:bible:notes:ezr:08:15|8:16]]. AT: "Next I sent those men to Iddo" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Next I sent them to Iddo

contextId.information: Ezra was showing everyone how unhappy he was that people were doing things that offended God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I tore apart my clothing and robe and pulled out hair from my head and beard
